column2: Job Description:        They have to assign security officers their duties and they themselves have to be in charge of monitoring the CCTVs          They have to make an inspection and cover all the vulnerable spots          They have to arrange all the shifts, weekly offs, leaves etc., for them          Security supervisors have to prepare reports for the security agency on the happenings that take place in their workplace          They have to make surprise inspections to see if all security officers are in their assigned places          If any incident does take place, they have to inform the authorities so no legal problems take place in the future          They are responsible for all that happens during their shift, hence, they have to make reports on all of it          They have to train all the new security officers regarding all the security protocols of the agency

column1: Security Control Room Operator - Security & Safety Management
column2: Role & responsibilities   The purpose of this position is to ensure the timely issuance of access cards and ID badges, monitoring the CCTV systems and health of the electronic security and safety equipment from the Security Control Room.   Respond and address all ID badging and access card requests (activation, deactivation, and destruction) and their respective tickets. Responsible for monitoring of CCTV footage and initiating notifications for violations. Review and saving of CCTV footage and access log reports for investigations of security incidents. Preparation of subsequent report for the Site Security Lead Daily health checks on the functionality of the security and safety equipment and software's Maintaining the database for access controls reports (door user list, swipe reports, event reports, etc.) for weekly reviews Address and coordinate in case of any alarms in the Security Control Room and prepare the required reports with the root cause. Address emails from employees on basic queries, employee notifications and visitor management. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor / Master's degree with at least 1 years' experience in the security industry Knowledge of computers and security related software Clear communication in English (written and verbal) Experience with Security Control Room operations Experience with electronic security and life safety systems - hardware and software (CCTV, access control system, fire alarm system, intrusion systems, etc.)
column11: Safety Officer Activities, Security Management, Control Room, Cctv Monitoring, Security Operations, Intrusion Detection, Fire Alarm System, Safety Management, Electronic Security, English Language, Communication Skills, Hardware, Software, Access Control, Security Monitoring
